intro: Hypodiscus aristatus var. protractus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hypodiscus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it a subject of interest in horticulture and ecological studies.
